text.headline: Demo - Library History Timeline
text.text: A CollectionBuilder-CONTENTdm demo for the Folklore Collection

text.headline: North Carolina folklore [3.1 July 1955]
text.text: Third volume (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in July 1955. The publication was suspended from July 1948 until Aug. 1954 and from Oct. 1954-June 1955. Volume published in Chapel Hill, North Carolina.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore [3.2 December 1955]
text.text: Third volume (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in December 1955. The publication was suspended from July 1948 until Aug. 1954 and from Oct. 1954-June 1955. Volume published in Chapel Hill, North Carolina.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [34.2 Fall-Summer 1987]
text.text: Volume 34 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for summer-fall 1987. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: A Moravian brass band plays at Easter sunrise services, Old Salem, 1985.  Photo: Thomas McGowan.

media.caption: North Carolina folklore journal [Special issue 25 April 1977]

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [Special issue 25 April 1977]
text.text: Volume 25 (special issue) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in April 1977. Volume devoted to artists and artisans of Appalachia.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [42.2 Summer-Fall 1995]
text.text: Volume 42 (number2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for summer-fall 1995. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image Bessie Eldreth sits with her granddaughter Stacey Eldreth on the porch of her home, Watauga County, NC, summer 1988.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [30.2 Fall-Winter 1982]
text.text: Volume 30 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for fall-winter 1982. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Crazy quilt by Zenna Todd of Ennice, North Carolina. Photo: Geraldine Johnson, American Folklife Center BR-45-20544.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [36.2 Summer-Fall 1989]
text.text: Volume 36 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for summer-fall 1989. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image Stanley Hicks shows a dulcimer and fretless banjo made in his workshop, Bethel community, Spring 1986. Photo Speed Hallman.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [26.1 May 1978]
text.text: Volume 26 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in May 1978. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Bicentennial quilt by students at the Crossnore School, Avery County, North Carolina. Photo: David Gaines.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [23.1 February 1975]
text.text: Volume 23 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in February 1975. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [24.1 March 1976]

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [30.1 Spring-Summer 1982]
text.text: Volume 30 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for spring-summer 1982. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Tommy Jarrell at home, 1981.  Photo: Tom Rankin

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [39.2 Summer-Fall 1992]
text.text: Volume 39 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for summer-fall 1992. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Arliss Watford in front of his workshop, near Winford, Hertford County.  Photo: A. Everette James, Jr.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [27.1 May 1979]
text.text: Volume 27 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in May 1979. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Algia Mae Hinton of Zebulon, NC, performing at the North Carolina Folklife Festival, Durham, July 4, 1978. Photo: Bill Boyarsky.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [31.1 Spring-Summer 1983]
text.text: Volume 31 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for spring-summer 1983. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: National Heritage Fellow Ray Hicks and his wife Rosa. Summer 1982, Watauga County, NC.  Photo: Barbara McDermitt.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [42.1 Winter-Spring 1995]
text.text: Volume 42 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 1995. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image Sodom Laurel ballad singer Dellie Norton sits with her granddaughter Deleen Norton, July 1993. Photo Adrienne Hollifield.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [28.2 November 1980]
text.text: Volume 28 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in November 1980. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Manco Sneed, Cherokee, NC, 1970. Photo: Blanton Owen

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [35.2 Summer-Fall 1988]
text.text: Volume 35 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for summer-fall 1988. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Traditional basket maker Eva Wolfe of the Eastern Band of the Cherokee was the recipient of a 1988 Brown-Hudson Folklore Award. Photo: courtesy of the Indian Crafts Board, US Department of the Interior.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [26.2 September 1978]
text.text: Volume 26 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in September 1978. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Stanley Hicks of Vilas, NC, telling a Jack Tale at the North Carolina Folklife Festival, Durham, July 4, 1978.  Photo: Thomas McGowan

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [41.1 Winter-Spring 1994]
text.text: Volume 41 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 1994. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image Dorothy Cole Auman turns pottery at the wheel in her shop. Seagrove, NC, 1998. Phtoto Rob Amberg.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [38.2 Summer-Fall 1991]
text.text: Volume 38 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for summer-fall 1991. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image Ray Hicks performs at the Beech Mountain Story-Telling Festival, 1989. Photo Jon Wilmesherr.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [29.1 Spring-Summer 1981]
text.text: Volume 29 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for spring-summer 1981. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Rogers Whitener (left) and Alfred Adams (right) of Boone look over a mechanical toy made by Willard Watson (center). Deep Gap, NC, 1974.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [25.1 May 1977]
text.text: Volume 25 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in May 1977. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina.  Cover Image: Bascom Lamar Lunsford. Photo: courtesy of Memorial Library, Mars Hill College.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [34.1 Winter-Spring 1987]
text.text: Volume 34 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 1987. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Brown-Hudson Folklore Award winner Bertie Mae Dickens of Ennice, NC, plays at a music picnic in Galax, VA, Fall 1984. Photo: Cece Conway.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [23.3 August 1975]
text.text: Volume 23 (number 3) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in August 1975. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [32.2 Fall-Winter 1984]
text.text: Volume 32 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for fall-winter 1984. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Quiltmaker Lillie Lee with a great-granddaughter, Chatham County, NC, 1984. Photo: Mary Anne McDonald.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [45.2 Summer-Fall 1998]
text.text: Volume 45 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for summer-fall 1998. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Lester Gay’s decorative windmills, made from bicycle wheels, hubcaps, and other discarded material, greeted travelers out in front of his home on Bell’s Road, west of Fountain, Pitt County. Photo Karen Baldwin.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [39.1 Winter-Spring 1992]
text.text: Volume 39 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 1992. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Model of the trawler David Hartsell by Steve Lewis (29?).

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [40.1 Winter-Spring 1993]
text.text: Volume 40 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 1993. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: North Carolina Folk Heritage Award winner Bea Hensley at work in his shop, Spruce Pine, NC, 2 March 1992. Photo: Craig M. Stinson.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [31.2 Fall-Winter 1983]
text.text: Volume 31 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for fall-winter 1983. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: 1983 Brown-Hudson Folklore Award recipients Willard Watson, Ora Watson, and Joe Wilson.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [41.2 Summer-Fall 1994]
text.text: Volume 41 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for summer-fall 1994. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image Archie Green visits a work site at the University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, September 1994. Photo Dan Sears, UNC-CH News Services.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [43.1 Winter-Spring 1996]
text.text: Volume 43 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 1996. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image Poster for the Eighth Annual Core Sound Decoy Festival painted by David A. Lawrence of Harkers Island, NC.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [27.2 November 1979]
text.text: Volume 27 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in November 1979. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Burlon Craig, Vale Lincoln County, NC, turning the bottom section of a four-gallon churn. He will add the “cap” seen on the right to complete the piece.  Photo: Charles G. Zug III.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [47.1 Winter-Spring 2000]
text.text: Volume 47 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 2000. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: An exhibit in the Silver Family Museum, a framed article about the murder published in a High Point, North Carolina, newspaper in 1988. Photo Daniel Patterson.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [44.1-2 1997]
text.text: Volume 44 (numbers 1-2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for the entire year of 1997. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image Photographs of the North Carolina Museum of History exhibit on state Folk Heritage Award winners from 1994-96.  Photos Eric N. Blevins, NC Museum of History.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [49.2 Fall-Winter 2002]
text.text: Volume 49 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for fall-winter 2002. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Peter Wolf Toth with his Sequoyah statue, Cherokee, NC.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [48.1-2 Spring-Summer-Fall-Winter 2001]
text.text: Volume 48 (numbers 1 and 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for fall-winter 2001. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Contemporary potter Billy Henson and a sample of his work. Lyman, South Carolina, 1998.  Photo Paul Matheny.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [43.2 Summer-Fall 1996]
text.text: Volume 43 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for summer-fall 1996. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image A handmade license plate advertises the model boat making of James Allen Rose, 1996 Brown-Hudson Folkore Award recipient. Harkers Island, NC, 22 March 1996.  Photo Thomas McGowan.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [38.1 Winter-Spring 1991]
text.text: Volume 38 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 1991. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image Catalog cover for J.B. Cole’s Pottery, Montgomery County, c. 1930. Brown-Hudson Folklore Award winner Nell Cole Graves turns a pot at upper left. Photo Charles G. Zug III.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [40.2 Summer-Fall 1993]
text.text: Volume 40 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for summer-fall 1993. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: A scene from Calvin Henderson Wiley’s Roanoke as illustrated by Felix O. C. Darley in Sartain’s Union Magazine of Literature and Art in 1849.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [35.1 Winter-Spring 1988]
text.text: Volume 35 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 1988. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: W. Amos “Doc” Abrams plays a music box from his collection of roller organs and other mechanical music contraptions.  Dr. Abrams’s opening concert has been a tradition at annual meetings of the NC Folklore Society. Photo: David Huntley.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [50.1-2 Spring-Summer-Fall-Winter 2003]
text.text: Volume 50 (numbers 1 and 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for spring-summer-fall-winter 2003. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Images: Ray Hicks. Photo: Thomas McGowan. & Tommy Thompson. Photo: John Menapace, circa 1974.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [49.1 Spring-Summer 2002]
text.text: Volume 49 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for spring-summer 2002. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Betty Smith. Photo contributed.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [36.1 Winter 1989]
text.text: Volume 36 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 1989. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image Bertha Landis (seated) and her children, 1983;Left to right, first row John Landis, Priscilla Landis Daniel, Jessie Mae Landis Tharrington, Doshie Landis Winston, Robert Landis;Second row Fleming Landis, Zenas Landis, Truzell Landis;Top row: Tony Landis, Claude Landis. Photo Landis family photographs, 1983

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [45.1 Winter-Spring 1998]
text.text: Volume 45 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 1998. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Images: Upper left, house and fields, Lake Landing along SR 1117 (CFS-WM-008-3). Upper right, Larry Shaw cleans crab posts, Gull Rock Marina, Hyde County (CFS-WM-004-11). Lower left, William and Etta Mae Cuthrell display squares from her quilting, Kilkenny, Tyrrell County (CFS-WM-004-11). Lower right, concrete gravemarker, along SR 1303, New Lake, Hyde County (CFS-WM-002-18). All photos by W.T. Mansfield.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [37.1 Winter-Spring 1990]
text.text: Volume 37 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for winter-spring 1990. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image Wickerwork on a gondola at The Balloon Works, Statesville, NC, September 1987. Photo Patricia Gantt.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [47.2 Midwinter 2000]
text.text: Volume 47 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, as a Midwinter issue 2000. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: John Kooner by Kinda Werthwein.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [32.1 Spring-Summer 1984]
text.text: Volume 32 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for spring-summer 1984. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: The Hugh Dixon Homestead, northern and eastern elevations. March 1980, Snow Camp, NC. Photo: Rachel Osborn.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [33.1-2 1985-1986]
text.text: Volume 33 (numbers 1-2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for 1985-1986. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: Lulu Belle and Scotty Wiseman.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [28.1 May 1980]
text.text: Volume 28 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued in May 1980. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: The William Eli Taylor House today, Bear Grass, Martin County, NC. Photo Elmer Taylor Malone, Jr.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [55.2 Fall-Winter 2008]
text.text: Volume 55 (number 2) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for fall-winter 2008. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover image: Large section of the American Folklore Society Women’s Section quilt with block honoring Karen Baldwin at center. Allen (1963-2005) stringing hot peppers for his father-in-law, Otis Johnson, at the Johnson’s Farm stall, North Carolina Farmers Market.  Photo: John N. Wall, 2004.

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [55.1 Spring-Summer 2008]
text.text: Volume 55 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for spring-summer 2008. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover image: Felipe Jesus Consalvos, The Fun Doctor, circa 1920-1950s, mixed media collage on paper, 26 x 21 inches (FJC 517).

text.headline: North Carolina folklore journal [52.1 Spring-Summer 2005]
text.text: Volume 52 (number 1) of the North Carolina folklore journal, issued for spring-summer 2005. Published in Raleigh, North Carolina. Cover Image: At the end of the Portsmouth Homecoming hymn sing, Rudy Carter range the church bell to call everyone together for the worship service.  Rudy is a descendant of Rose Ireland, the former slave who remained on Portsmouth after the Civil War.  he is also the cousin of Henry Pigott (1896-1971), the last African American and the last make to live on Portsmouth Island.  Over the years, it became Henry’s responsibility to ring the bell.  Photo: Jan Eason, 2004.
